issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram VI on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with two mural elements, crescent above forehead; crescent, above covered korymbos; ribbed, triangular ribbons at back end of pearl diadem; between crown cap and crescent ribbed, triangular ribbons pointing to the left and to the right; diadem ribbons commencing to the left and right behind the shoulders; pointing upwards; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast, right shoulder decorated with star, no crescent outside the rim, rigged border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 2 h l. i.’whlmzd, 11 h l. o. ʼpzwn'| Wahām abzōn| “Wahram, increase”
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements, altar shaft, to the left and the right of the shaft ribbons pointing upwards; four altar slabs; altar flames rendered as four tiers of four, three, two and one strokes respectively; star to left  and the right of altar flames, crescent to the right and left of altar shaft below altar ribbons, to the left and the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Wistham faces towards altar holding sword with both hands, regnal year at 9 h; ridged border
